lines.text: I want a girl who's smart, a girl who can teach me things. I hate stupid women. You know why? You marry a stupid girl, you have stupid kids. You don't believe me? Follow a stupid kid home and see if somebody stupid don't answer the door.
I must have that disease, what's the name of it?
It's called Stupid.

[mocking Christopher after he got stood up]
I'll meet you at the club in two hours.
I got waylaid.
No, you got la-aid!
If two people really loved each other, they couldn't be separated no matter what happened.
You were with that boy.
He's not a boy. He's a man.
He's not a man. He's a gigolo. Do you know what a gigolo is? It's a fancy word for whore.
There are many words for whore, and I'm sure you're acquainted with all of them.
I love you.

[angrily]
No, you don't.
Then I hate you.

[more sincerely]
No, you don't.
Then I love you.
Define love.
Remove this peasant from my party! Take his friend, too. I'm having trouble breathing.
Maybe if you took off your chastity belt, you could breathe a little mo' betta!
Tell me Mary, is it true that you're engaged?
Yes.
Tsk, tsk, what a pity. Sometimes life can be so shitty. Here's a girl who's smart and pretty...
And rich.
I don't care about that! Honey, I really don't.

[writing something on a napkin]
It's obvious that little Miss Mary has never been off the city block.
[holds up napkin, which has "Wrecka Stow" written on it]
What is that? Some new language?
Read it. Do you know what it is?
It's nothing, you ninny. And you know it, but you won't confess it because you're such a coward.
It is something, something you don't know, and you won't confess that because *you're* a coward!
This is silly, and you're a child!

[taunting Mary]
I go to dinner without my father's permission. Now, read it aloud so we can all hear how knowledgeable you are!
Wrecka stow.

[laughs at Mary's pronounciation]
Do you know what it is?
Wrecka stow, wrecka stow, it's nothing!

[laughing]
It is something. Come on, say it again louder.
Wrecka stow.
Louder!
Wrecka stow! I give up. What is it?
If you wanted to buy a Sam Cook a'blum, where would you go?

[rolls her eyes]
The wrecka stow.
If you don't get out of my house, I'll have my father's guards throw you out!
Why? 'Cause you ain't bad enough to do it yo'self?
You low shit! What'd you do that for?
Cause it's a full moon, I'm a werewolf, bitch, KISS MY ASS!
I ain't afraid of shit!
You afraid of bats?
[they see bats on the roof of the restaurant they are at]
BATS!
[they run out, screaming]
I do nothing professionally, I do everything for fun.
[repeated line]
Life is a parade.
Why you selfish son of a biscuit-eater!

[Christopher writes something on a check]
Fa you?
Tell him it's Chinese.
Why is your father such a punk?
I beg your pardon?
Why does he shit on so many people?
You are a peasant.
What makes me a peasant? How much money I got, or what's in my heart?
You're gonna end up with no friends at all!
I don't need friends! I'm my own man, just like Liberace!
Goodness will guide me. When love is inside me. Until then, Life's a parade!

[practicing her retort]
"Maybe if you took off your jock strap, you could breathe a little easier!" I should've said that. I should've said, "Chastity belt? You're sadly mistaken, sir. I wear a cestus. Perhaps you've heard of it? It's an embroidered girdle originally worn by Venus, and it inspires love. Perhaps you've heard of love? I doubt it." He's just a peasant. He doesn't even know who Venus is.

[talking about Isaac Sharon]
He's a little possessive, don't you think?
He likes to collect things, including people.
You must be his prized possession.
